meanings.definition: A straight line or plane that touches a curve or curved surface at a single point without crossing it.
meanings.sent1: The tangent of the circle gently met the edge.
meanings.sent2: She drew a tangent to the curve on the graph.
meanings.sent3: The tangent of the roller coaster hugged the loop tightly.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a tangent to her heart, touching briefly and then moving on.
meanings.sent5: The tangent of the mountain against the sky was a perfect silhouette.

meanings.definition: A completely different line of thought or action.
meanings.sent1: Her tangent about unicorns had everyone intrigued.
meanings.sent2: We need to focus on the main topic, not go off on a tangent.
meanings.sent3: His tangent on aliens visiting Earth was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The idea of time travel was a fascinating tangent in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The tangent of starting a new business venture excited him.
